quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Switch[/h1]

In cases when you need to test for multiple conditions, writing[b] if else[/b] statements for each condition might be not the best solution. 
The [b]switch statement[/b] is used to perform different actions based on different conditions.

[b]Syntax:[/b] [code format="js" ][b]switch[/b] (expression) {
 [b] case [/b]n1: 
     statements
     [b]break[/b];
 [b] case[/b] n2: 
     statements
     [b]break[/b];
  [b]default[/b]: 
     statements
}[/code]
The switch expression is evaluated once. The value of the expression is compared with the values of each [b]case[/b]. If there is a match, the associated block of code is executed.
[note]You can achieve the same result with multiple if...else statements, but the switch statement is more effective in such situations.[/note]

quizzes.question: How many "case" statements are usually used in the "switch" statement?

quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The break Keyword[/h1]

When JavaScript code reaches a [b]break [/b]keyword, it breaks out of the switch block.
This will stop the execution of more code and case testing inside the block.
[note]Usually, a [b]break [/b]should be put in each case statement.[/note]
